translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلای بزرگ! [[«أَلْقَارِعَةُ»: کوبنده. مصیبت سخت و بزرگ را می‌گویند (نگا: رعد / 31). نامی از نامهای قیامت است. مانند: حاقّه (نگا: حاقّه / 1)، طامّه (نگا: نازعات / 34)، صاخّه (نگا: عبس / 33). مراد سرآغاز قیامت است که جهان را در هم می‌کوبد و هول و هراس آن، دلها را به تپش می‌اندازد. البتّه چنین خوف و فزع و وحشت و هراسی، کافران و منافقان و مشرکان و فاجران را در بر می‌گیرد، و مؤمنان در شادی و شادخواری بوده و دور از شدائد و مصائب می‌باشند (نگا: بقره / 262، مائده / 69، یونس / 62، زخرف / 68، احقاف / 13).]]

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چيست قارعه؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چه كوبنده‌اى! [كه قابل وصف نيست‌

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چيست كوبنده؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: قارعه چیست؟ (همان روز وحشت و اضطراب مرگ و قیامت است که دلهای خلایق را از ترس در هم کوبد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلای بزرگ چیست و چگونه است؟! [[«مَا»: چیست؟ چگونه است؟!]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: درهم کوب چیست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و چه حادثه کوبنده‌ای!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چیست کوبنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چيست آن كوبنده؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چیست کوبنده‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What is the startling calamity?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: What is the event that terrifies the hearts?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What is the Clatterer?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: What is the Striking?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: What is the striking (Hour)?

translations.text: What is Al-Qari`ah

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: What is the Clatterer?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: What is the (Day) of Noise and Clamour?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و تو چه می دانی آن کوبنده چیست؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و تو چه دانى كه قارعه چيست؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و تو چه مى‌دانى آن كوبنده چيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و تو چه دانى كه كوبنده چيست؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چگونه حالت آن روز هولناک را تصور توانی کرد؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو چه می‌دانی بلای بزرگ چیست و چگونه است؟! [[«مَآ أَدْرَاکَ»: تو چه می‌دانی؟! (نگا: حاقّه / 3، مدّثّر / 27، مرسلات / 14).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تو چه دانی که درهم کوب چیست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و تو چه می‌دانی که حادثه کوبنده چیست؟! (آن حادثه همان روز قیامت است!)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و چه دانستت چیست کوبنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چه دانى تو كه چيست آن كوبنده؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چه فهمانیدت (که) کوبنده چیست‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: How will you comprehend what the startling calamity is? --

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And what have you understood, what the event that terrifies the hearts is!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And what shall teach thee what is the Clatterer?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: What shall Make thee know that which the Striking is?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And what will make you know what the striking (Hour) is?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: What will explain to you what the Shocker is?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And what do you know what the Calamity is?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And what will make you know what Al-Qari`ah is

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Calamity is!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: What will show you what is the Catastrophe?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What shall let you know what the Clatterer is!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Would that you knew what the crash is!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And what will make you comprehend what the terrible calamity is?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama adraka ma alqariAAatu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Would that you knew what the Clatterer is!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And what will explain to thee what the (Day) of Noise and Clamour is?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: روزی که مردم [در سراسیمگی] چون پروانه های پراکنده اند

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: روزى است كه مردم چون پروانگان پراكنده باشند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: روزى كه مردم مانند پروانگان پراكنده باشند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: روزى كه مردم چون پروانه‌[هاى‌] پراكنده گردند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آن روز سخت، مردم مانند ملخ هر سو پراکنده شوند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: روزی است که مردمان، همچو پروانگانِ پراکنده (در اینجا و آنجا حیران و سرگردان) می‌گردند. [[«یَوْمَ»: قیامت، مدّت زمانی است که با نفخه صور اوّل شروع و با داوری در میان مردم پایان می‌گیرد. «الْفَرَاشِ»: پروانه. اسم جنس است. مراد پروانه‌هائی است که شبها دیوانه‌وار و حیران پیرامون نور چراغ می‌گردند و می‌سوزند و می‌افتند. عربها، در سرگشتگی و نادانی و بی‌خبری از عاقبت کار، به پروانه ضرب‌المثل می‌زنند. «الْمَبْثُوثِ»: پراکنده.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: روزی که مردم مانند پروانه‌های پراکنده باشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: روزی که مردم مانند پروانه‌های پراکنده خواهند بود،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: روزی که شوند مردم چون پروانه‌های پراکنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: روزى كه مردمان همچون پروانگان پراكنده باشند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روزی که مردم همچون پروانه پراکنده‌اند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: A Day on which human beings would be like so many scattered moths,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The day when men will be like scattered moths.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The day that men shall be like scattered moths,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: A Day whereon mankind shall become as moths scattered,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: It is a Day whereon mankind will be like moths scattered about,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The Day when the people will be like scattered moths.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On that Day human beings shall be like scattered moths,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: It is a Day whereon mankind will be like moths scattered about.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A day wherein mankind will be as thickly-scattered moths

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [It is] the day when mankind will be like scattered moths

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On that Day people shall become like scattered moths

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On that day, people will be like scattered moths

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The day on which men shall be as scattered moths,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yawma yakoonu alnnasu kaalfarashi almabthoothi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: [It is] a Day when mankind shall be like scattered moths

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (It is) a Day whereon men will be like moths scattered about,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و کوه ها مانند پشم رنگین حلاجی شده گردد!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و كوه‌ها چون پشم‌زده شده.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و كوه‌ها چون پشم رنگين حلاجى شده شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و كوه‌ها مانند پشم زده‌شده رنگين شود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و کوهها همچون پشم زده شده متلاشی گردد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و کوهها، همسان پشمِ رنگارنگِ حلّاجی شده می‌شوند. [[«الْعِهْنِ»: پشم. پشم رنگ شده. «الْمَنفُوشِ»: زده شده. حلاّجی شده.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کوهها مانند پشمهای زده باشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و کوه‌ها مانند پشم رنگین حلاّجی‌شده می‌گردد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و شوند کوه‌ها مانند پشم زده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و كوه‌ها مانند پشم رنگين زده‌شده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و کوه‌ها مانند پشمِ زده‌شده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The mountains like the tufts of carded wool.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And mountains will be like flying wool.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and the mountains shall be like plucked wool-tufts.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the mountains shall become as wool carded,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And the mountains will be like carded wool,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the mountains will be like tufted wool.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and the mountains shall be like fluffs of carded wool in varying colours.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And the mountains will be like wool, carded.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the mountains will become as carded wool.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and the mountains like carded wool.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and the mountains like tufts of carded wool.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and mountains will be like carded wool.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the mountains shall be as loosened wool.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Watakoonu aljibalu kaalAAihni almanfooshi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and the mount-ains like tufts of carded wool.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And the mountains will be like carded wool.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اما هرکس اعمال وزن شده اش سنگین و باارزش است؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما هر كه كفّه ترازويش سنگين باشد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس اما هر كه وزنه اعمالش سنگين باشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اما هر كه سنجيده‌هايش سنگين برآيد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس عمل هر کس را در میزان حق وزنی باشد،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کسی که ترازوی (حسنات و نیکیهای) او سنگین باشد. [[«ثَقُلَتْ»: سنگین گردید. «مَوَازِینُ»: جمع میزان، ترازوها. جمع بستن آن برای تعظیم است. یا جمع موزون، کشیده‌ها و سنجیده‌ها. یعنی اعمال انسان (نگا: اعراف / 8).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در آن حال هر کس کفه‌ها[ی اعمال خیر]ش سنگینی کند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا کسی که (در آن روز) ترازوهای اعمالش سنگین است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس اما آنکه سنگین آید سنجشهایش (ترازوهایش)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس هر كه ترازوى كردارش سنگين باشد- كارهاى با ارزش داشته باشد-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس اما هر کس میزان‌هایش سنگین بود،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then he whose deeds shall weigh heavier in the scale

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So for one whose scales prove heavy,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then he whose deeds weigh heavy in the Balance

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then as for him whose balances are heavy,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then as for him whose balance (of good deeds) will be heavy,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As for he whose scales are heavy.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then he whose scales weigh heavier

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then as for him whose Balance will be heavy,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then, as for him whose scales are heavy (with good works),

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: As for him, whose deeds weigh heavy in the scales,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then he whose deeds weigh heavy in the Scale

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Those whose good deeds will weigh heavier (on the scale)

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then as for him whose measure of good deeds is heavy,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faamma man thaqulat mawazeenuhu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then, the one whose good deeds weigh heavy on the scales,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then, he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) heavy,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس او در یک زندگی خوش و پسندیده ای است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در يك زندگى پسنديده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس وى در يك زندگى رضايت بخشى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس وى در زندگى خوشى خواهد بود!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: او در بهشت به آسایش و زندگانی خوش خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او در زندگی رضایت بخشی بسر می‌برد. [[«عِیشَةٍ»: زندگی. «رَاضِیَةٍ»: رضایت بخش. یعنی زندگیی که صاحب آن بدان راضی و از آن خوشنود است (نگا: حاقّه / 21).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: او در زندگانی پسندیده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در یک زندگی خشنودکننده خواهد بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس او است در زندگی پسندیده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس او در زندگانى پسنديده و خوشايندى است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هم(او) در زندگی‌ای خوشایند است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Will have a tranquil life;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He is therefore in the desired bliss.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: shall inherit a pleasing life,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He shall be in a lifewell-pleasing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He will live a pleasant life (in Paradise).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He will be in a pleasant life.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: shall have a blissful life;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He will live a pleasant life.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He will live a pleasant life.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: he will have a pleasing life.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: shall live in a life which is pleasing,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He will be in a pleasant life.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: will live a pleasant life,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He shall live a pleasant life.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fahuwa fee AAeeshatin radiyatin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: will have a most pleasing life.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Will be in a life of good pleasure and satisfaction.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اما هرکساعمال وزن شده اش سبک و بی ارزش است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اما هر كه كفه ترازويش سبك باشد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اما آنكه وزنه اعمالش سبك شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما هر كه سنجيده‌هايش سبك بر آيد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و عمل هر کس بی قدر و سبک وزن باشد،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا کسی که ترازوی (حسنات و نیکیهای) او سبک شود. [[«خَفَّتْ»: سبک گردید. مراد سبک شدن حسنات، یا به عبارت دیگر، کمتر بودن حسنات از سیّئات است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اما کسی که کفه‌هایش سبکی یابد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و امّا کسی که ترازوهایش سبک است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اما آنکه سبک گردد ترازوهایش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اما هر كه ترازوى كردارش سبك باشد- كار شايسته نداشته باشد-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اما هر که میزان‌هایش سبک بود،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But he whose deeds are lighter in the balance

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And for one whose scales prove light,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: but he whose deeds weigh light in the Balance

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And as for him whose balances are light,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But as for him whose balance (of good deeds) will be light,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But as for he whose scales are light.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: but he whose scales weigh lighter,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But as for him whose Balance will be light,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But as for him whose scales are light,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But as for him, whose deeds weigh light in the scales,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: but he whose weight is light in the Scale,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But as for one whose scales are light,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: but those whose good deeds will be lighter (on the scale).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And as for him whose measure of good deeds is light,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waamma man khaffat mawazeenuhu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But as for him whose deeds are light on the scales,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) light,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس جایگاه و پناهگاهش هاویه است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جايگاهش در هاويه است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس جايگاهش هاويه است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس جايش «هاويه» باشد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: جایگاهش در قعر هاویه (جهنم) است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مادرِ (مهربان) او، پرتگاه (ژرف دوزخ) است (و برای در آغوش کشیدن او، دهان خود را به سویش باز کرده است). [[«أُمُّ»: مادر. برای ریشخند است. مراد مأوی و جایگاه است. «هَاوِیَةٌ»: پرتگاه و محلّ سقوط اشیاء بدان. اسمی از اسماء دوزخ است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بازگشتگاه او دوزخ است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پناهگاهش «هاویه» [= دوزخ‌] است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس مادر اوست هاویه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس جايگاه او دوزخ است- كه در آن سرنگون شود-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: محور و مقصدش پرتگاهی آتشین است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Will have the Abyss for abode.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He is in the lap of one that abases.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: shall plunge in the womb of the Pit.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: His dwelling shall be the Abyss.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He will have his home in Hawiyah (pit, i.e. Hell).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: His home is the Abyss.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: his shall be the deep pit for a dwelling.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: His mother will be Hawiyah.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A bereft and Hungry One will be his mother,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: his home will be the Abyss.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: his head will be in the Plunging

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: His refuge will be an abyss.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: will have hawiyah as their dwelling.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: His abode shall be the abyss.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faommuhu hawiyatun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: the Abyss shall be his home.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Will have his home in a (bottomless) Pit.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و تو چه می دانی هاویه چیست؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و تو چه دانى كه هاويه چيست؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و تو چه مى‌دانى آن چيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و تو چه دانى كه آن چيست؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چگونه سختی هاویه را تصور توانی کرد؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو چه می‌دانی، پرتگاه دوزخ چیست و چگونه است؟! [[«مَاهِیَهْ»: مرکب است از (مَا) استفهام و (هِیَ) ضمیر و (هْ) سکته (نگا: حاقّه / 19).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تو چه دانی آن چیست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و تو چه می‌دانی «هاویه» چیست؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و ندانستت چیست آن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و تو چه دانى كه آن چيست؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چه فهمانیدت (آن) پرتگاه چیست‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: How will you comprehend what that is?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And what have you understood, what the one that abases is!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And what shall teach thee what is the Pit?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And what shall make thee know that which she is?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And what will make you know what it is?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do you know what it is?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And what do you know what that is?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And what will make you know what it is

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Ah, what will convey unto thee what she is! -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And what will show you what it is?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What shall let you know what the Plunging is?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And what can make you know what that is?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Would that you knew what hawiya his?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And what will make you know what it is?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama adraka ma hiyah

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: What will convey to you what this is like?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And what will explain to thee what this is?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آتشی بسیار داغ و سوزاناست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آتشى است در نهايت گرمى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آتشى سوزنده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آتشى است سوزنده.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: هاویه همان آتش سخت سوزنده و گدازنده است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آتش بزرگ بسیار گرم و سوزانی است. [[«حَامِیَةٌ»: بسیار گرم و سوزان (نگا: غاشیه / 4).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آتشی است [بس‌] سوزان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آتشی است سوزان!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آتشی است سوزنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آتشى است سخت سوزنده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آتشی است سوزنده و گدازنده.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is the scorching fire.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: A flaming fire!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: A blazing Fire!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: A Fire vehemently hot!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (It is) a hot blazing Fire!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: A Raging Fire.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: A Blazing Fire!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: A fire Hamiyah!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Raging Fire.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is a scorching fire!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (It is) a Fire which is extremely hot.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It is a Fire, intensely hot.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is a burning Fire.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: A burning fire.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Narun hamiyatun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It is a blazing fire.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (It is) a Fire Blazing fiercely!
